Docs.summary: Exposes methods that are called to notify the root element of a fragment when a UI Automation client application begins or ends listening for events.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AdviseEventAdded (int eventId, int[] properties);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void AdviseEventAdded(int32 eventId, int32[] properties) cil managed

Docs.param: The identifier of the event being added.
The identifiers of the properties being added, or if the event listener being added is not listening for property events.
Docs.summary: Notifies the UI Automation provider when a UI Automation client begins listening for a specific event, including a property-changed event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method enables the provider to reduce overhead by raising only events that are being listened for.
The `eventId` can be compared with the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier.Id%2A> of an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent> such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPatternIdentifiers.WindowClosedEvent>. You can also obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent> by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent.LookupById%2A>.
## Examples The following example adds to a list of property changes that have been subscribed to.

Docs.param: The identifier of the event being removed
The identifiers of the properties being removed, or if the event listener being removed is not listening for property events.
Docs.summary: Notifies the UI Automation provider when a UI Automation client stops listening for a specific event, including a property-changed event.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method enables the UI Automation provider to reduce overhead by not raising events that are no longer being listened for.
The `eventId` can be compared with the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationIdentifier.Id%2A> of an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent> such as <xref:System.Windows.Automation.WindowPatternIdentifiers.WindowClosedEvent>. You can also obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent> by using <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEvent.LookupById%2A>.
## Examples The following example removes property changes from a list of those that have been subscribed to.
